SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

edu.cmu.cs.plural.annot
Annotation Type Perm

@Target(value={METHOD,CONSTRUCTOR})
public @interface Perm

This is a general permission annotation for a method. If you don't want to use Share, Pure and the like, you can use this permission instead and specify requires/ensures in our text language. The major difference is that you must use #0, #1, etc. when referring to method parameters, b/c these names will be eliminated during compilation. 'result' and 'this' still work as usual. Use Cases to annotate a method with multiple Perm annotations.

Since:
Apr 2, 2008
Author:
Nels Beckman
See Also:
For language grammar.

Optional Element Summary
 java.lang.String ensures
          Permission that is returned after calling this method specified in our textual permission language.
 java.lang.String requires
          Permission that is required to call this method specified in our textual permission language.
 

requires

public abstract java.lang.String requires
Permission that is required to call this method specified in our textual permission language. Default is empty.

Default:
""

ensures

public abstract java.lang.String ensures
Permission that is returned after calling this method specified in our textual permission language. Default is empty.

Default:
""
